page.title: 10HOUSING IN TYNEMOUTH
page.content: Tynemouth grew up as an attractive place for people who worked in the city of Newcastle upon Tyne to live, particularly at the end of the 19th and beginning of the 20th centuries. Many streets of grand terraced houses were built at this time and were the homes of fairly well-off people. A further spate of building occurred in the 1930s. There has been very little building since World War II (1939-1945). In recent years, many of the large terraced houses have become too big for late 20th century living and they have been turned into smaller units - flats and maisonettes. Life styles have changed a great deal and people no longer have such large families or servants to warrant the upkeep of a 7 or 10 bedroomed house.
